result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 09:08 AM Defendant Gregory Michael Smith appeared with Atty Rafferty and Atty Wickman from Atty Rafferty's office via Zoom. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Complaint recieved, charges reviewed, waives reading.  Def waives TL for prelim.  Requests PTC be set. June 30 at 9:00 a.m. for PTC. Nothing further.  Adj.  9:10 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 000508,
Payable Number: 35811,
Receipt Number: 22R 000830,
Amount: $20.00
Denying Petition for Appt. of Attorney

4/5/2022 at 10:47 a.m.  PC/BOND HEARING MINUTES:  MIKE KORPELA PRESIDING, KLR RECORDING ON DAR.  Court calls case.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court explains PC hearing.  Court reads PC statement.  Five counts.  10:49 a.m.  Lt. Foryan sworn in, direct by DA.  Officer identifies def.  Further direct.  Def was located in Iron County.  Def does not have any cross.  Court-no questions.  Court provides background re SW.  Court signed SW.  Statement is consistent with materials Court reviewed with officer.  PC that crime committed 948.12 and that def is one who committed offense.  Court has signed PC statement, provides to Clerk.  DA requests bond conditions, 2500 cash with no contact with children under 18, no access through computer, cellphone or tablet to Internet.  Asks for Init to be set for mid-May.  Court states to set with those involved.  Def's unsure off process re bond.  Court explains process.  Right to atty explained.  Court explains property needs to be examined, etc.  Court indicates if def can post and comply with bond, could be released.  Def states cannot post himself.  Parents are present today.  Mother indicates cash bond could be provided by them.  Court sets $2500 cash bond.  Parents can post.  Expected N/C with children under age of 18.  Court questions re living at home.  Parents indicate Internet access at home.  Court advises not to access parents' computers at all.  Do not touch.  Could be bail jumping.  Court enters no access and no contact provision.  Court confirms def's residence.  If any change, to notify the Sheriff and Prosecutor's office.  Court orders bond along those terms.  Def indicates needs to have cellphone to communicate as a dump truck driver.  DA states phone can have no Internet access.  Def indicates he can make arrangements with employer to disable Internet.  Mother addresses Court re NC with children.  Court explains further.  DA has no problem with def being in both Iron and Gogebic County.  If further, def to inform Court and DA.  Adj.  11:01 a.m.  klr
